hero.tagline: A Business Bridge between Africa and the Indian Ocean

welcome.title: Welcome to AIOCCI
welcome.paragraph1: The Africa â€“ Indian Ocean Chamber of Commerce and Industry (AIOCCI) is an international economic platform dedicated to structuring trade exchanges, promoting investment, and fostering sustainable economic cooperation between Africa, the Indian Ocean region, and the rest of the world.
welcome.paragraph2: AIOCCI facilitates strategic connections between businesses, investors, institutions, and economic decision-makers by creating high-value platforms for dialogue, business development, and collaboration.
welcome.paragraph3: Through its initiatives, AIOCCI supports the growth and strengthening of African and regional economic ecosystems, enhances market attractiveness, and contributes to an open, responsible, and forward-looking economic integration.

foundingStory.title: Our Values and Strategic Objectives
foundingStory.description:
AIOCCI is a business-oriented Chamber of Commerce and Industry bringing together private sector leaders, institutions, entrepreneurs, and investors committed to developing strong and sustainable economic links between Africa and the Indian Ocean region.

Founded as an independent and inclusive platform, AIOCCI acts as a bridge between markets, cultures, and economic opportunities.
foundingStory.imageAlt: A diverse group of African and Indian Ocean professionals in formal business attire during a business meeting in a modern office with panoramic views

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: To become a leading economic platform connecting Africa and the Indian Ocean, facilitating trade, investment, innovation, and sustainable development at regional and international levels.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Promote trade and investment between Africa and the Indian Ocean region; facilitate business connections and cross-border partnerships; support companies in their international expansion; organize high-level corporate and economic events; and strengthen regional integration and private sector cooperation.

cadreJuridique.title: Notre Mission
cadreJuridique.description: AIOCCI is governed by Ordinance No 60-133 of October 3, 1960, relating to associations in the Republic of Madagascar, and conducts its activities in strict compliance with all applicable national and international regulations.

section.title: Our Vision and Mission
section.subtitle: Building economic bridges between Africa and the Indian Ocean for shared prosperity

section.title: What We Do
section.subtitle: Tailored solutions at every stage of your development

businessTrade.title: Business and Trade Facilitation
businessTrade.description: We assist companies in identifying business opportunities, partners, and markets across Africa and the Indian Ocean region.

investment.title: Investment Promotion
investment.description: AIOCCI promotes investment opportunities and connects investors with high-potential projects, enterprises, and strategic initiatives.

networking.title: Networking and Representation
networking.description: AIOCCI provides a structured platform for networking, representation, and advocacy for its members at national, regional, and international levels.

events.title: Corporate and Economic Events
events.description: AIOCCI designs and delivers high-level events, including:

expoMauritius.title: Africa Business Expo
expoMauritius.description: A large-scale international business and investment exhibition bringing together African, Indian Ocean, and global companies, investors, and institutions. The Expo aims to position Mauritius as a strategic hub for African and Indian Ocean trade and investment.

expoDubai.title: Africa Business Expo
expoDubai.description: An international edition of the Africa Business Expo, connecting African businesses with investors, partners, and markets in the Middle East and beyond, with a strong focus on trade, investment, and global expansion.

aiSummit.title: AI Meets Africa Summit
aiSummit.description: Positioned as the largest Artificial Intelligence summit in Africa, AI Meets Africa Summit brings together policymakers, tech leaders, investors, startups, researchers, and institutions to shape the future of AI, digital transformation, and innovation across the continent.

emploi.title: Carrefour Emploi and Ã‰tudes
emploi.description: A major employment and education fair organized in Madagascar, connecting students, professionals, universities, training institutions, and recruiters at national and international levels.

educationExpo.title: International Education Expo
educationExpo.description: Bringing together international universities, education providers, and students, with a strong focus on international mobility, skills development, and academic partnerships.

ceoForum.title: CEO Business Forum
ceoForum.description: A high-level business forum dedicated to CEOs, executives, and decision-makers, fostering dialogue on leadership, investment, economic strategy, and private-sector-driven development in Africa and the Indian Ocean region.

partners: Chambers of commerce and business councils

president.title: Chairman
president.organization: African Indian Ocean Chamber of Commerce & Industry
president.imageAlt: Rojo Claudino Andrianasolo - Chairman of AIOCCI
paragraphs: The African Indian Ocean Chamber of Commerce & Industry (AIOCCI) was conceived as a place of convergence, where paths meet, ideas circulate, and constructive energies align to strengthen economic cooperation between Africa, the Indian Ocean region, and international partners.

In a world undergoing deep transformation, progress can no longer be built in isolation. It requires listening, balance, and shared intent. AIOCCI offers a framework where stakeholders may meet with openness, exchange with respect, and contributeâ€”each according to their meansâ€”to initiatives that are meant to last.
As a private, independent, and non-profit organization, AIOCCI is guided by principles that value integrity, discretion, inclusion, and responsibility.
Our ambition is to bring together diverse forces, facilitate meaningful cooperation, and support long-term partnerships that contribute to balanced, inclusive, and sustainable economic development.
Whether you are rooted in Africa, connected to the Indian Ocean region, or engaged across borders, AIOCCI welcomes you to join this dynamic of cooperation and constructive dialogue.
president.closing: Together, let us build strong economic bridges beyond borders, grounded in trust, shared values, and a common vision of prosperity.
president.slogan: Building Strong Economic Bridges Beyond Borders

ceoBusinessForum.title: CEO Business Forum
ceoBusinessForum.description: In line with its mission to strengthen economic cooperation and build strategic bridges between regions, the African Indian Ocean Chamber of Commerce & Industry (AIOCCI) supported and promoted the CEO Business Forum â€“ Indian Ocean, held in Madagascar in 2024. The forum brought together business leaders, investors and decision-makers from 25 countries worldwide, positioning Madagascar as a key meeting point for high-level economic dialogue in the Indian Ocean region. Through this initiative, AIOCCI reaffirmed its role as a platform for private economic diplomacy, fostering cross-border partnerships, facilitating investment discussions and contributing to the emergence of a more integrated and competitive regional economic ecosystem.

carrefour.title: Employment and Education Fair
carrefour.description: As part of its commitment to human capital development and international cooperation, AIOCCI supported and promoted the Employment & Education Fair 2025, a major initiative dedicated to employability, education, and academic mobility. Held in Madagascar, the event brought together more than 50 leading international institutions and schools, notably from the United Arab Emirates, Canada, Mauritius, as well as other partner countries. It provided a dynamic platform for exchange between educational institutions, businesses, recruiters, and young talents. Through this initiative, AIOCCI actively contributes to bridging education systems and the professional world, promoting access to international opportunities, and addressing labor market needs through a sustainable and inclusive approach.

highlightsSection.title: Fair Highlights
highlightsSection.subtitle: Key Moments of the Employment & Education Fair {year}

editorialPrestige.lead: In Mauritius, AIOCCI â€“ the African Indian Ocean Chamber of Commerce & Industry had the honor of presenting a shared economic vision before ministers, ambassadors, consuls, business leaders, and representatives of major international institutions.

paragraphs.p1: This high-level exchange demonstrated AIOCCIâ€™s ability to bring decision-makers together, foster dialogue, and generate concrete perspectives for Madagascar, Mauritius, the Indian Ocean region, and Africa.
paragraphs.p2: Beyond the event itself, this meeting marks a significant milestone in AIOCCIâ€™s international outreach, confirming its role as a platform for economic cooperation, influence, and transformation.

quote.text: The future is built through dialogue, trust, and collective action.
quote.author: AIOCCI Vision 2025

closing.line1: AIOCCI continues to build strong economic bridges

aboutAIOCCI.title: Why Africa and the Indian Ocean Matter

paragraph1.text: Africa and the Indian Ocean region stand at the heart of today's global economic transformation. Together, they represent a vast and dynamic economic space encompassing 54 African countries and more than 20 countries across the Indian Ocean region, forming one of the most strategic growth corridors in the world.
paragraph1.subtext: This space combines demographic strength, abundant natural resources, strategic geography, and rapidly expanding markets.

paragraph2.text: Africa is a continent of opportunity, innovation, and resilience. With a young and growing population, accelerating urbanization, increasing regional integration, and significant untapped potential across key sectors, Africa is steadily emerging as a major player in global trade, investment, and innovation.

paragraph3.text: The Indian Ocean region serves as a natural bridge between Africa, Asia, the Middle East, and global markets. It functions as a critical maritime, financial, and logistical hub, facilitating international trade flows, investment mobility, and economic connectivity across continents.

paragraph4.title: A Natural Economic Synergy
paragraph4.text: The convergence of Africa and the Indian Ocean creates a powerful and complementary economic synergy.
paragraph4.details: Africa offers scale, resources, talent, production capacity, and fast-growing consumer markets, while the Indian Ocean region provides connectivity, financial expertise, regulatory platforms, and direct access to international capital and global value chains.

paragraph5.text: Together, these regions form an integrated economic ecosystem capable of driving sustainable growth, industrial development, technological innovation, and cross-border cooperation at both regional and global levels.

paragraph6.title: AIOCCI's Strategic Positioning
paragraph6.text: AIOCCI places Africa and the Indian Ocean at the center of its action because their combined potential goes far beyond geography.
paragraph6.details: It represents a strategic alliance of over 70 countries, united by shared economic interests, trade flows, and development ambitions.

paragraph7.text: Through structured dialogue, facilitation of trade and investment, strengthening of regional value chains, and connection of local economies to global opportunities, AIOCCI contributes to a more balanced, inclusive, and forward-looking global economic architecture.

synergy.africaDescription: Scale, resources, talent, production capacity, and fast-growing consumer markets
synergy.indianOceanDescription: Connectivity, financial expertise, regulatory platforms, and access to global value chains

conclusion.highlight: Africa and the Indian Ocean are not only regions of the future.
conclusion.text: Together, they are strategic partners shaping the economy of today and tomorrow.

aboutAIOCCI.footer: The 54 countries of Africa and more than 20 countries across the Indian Ocean region
